017package com.googlecode.streamflyer.internal.thirdparty;
018
019import java.util.Collection;
020
021/**
022 * The code of this class is copied from <code>org.apache.commons.lang.Validate</code> 
023 * in order to avoid additional dependencies to other projects.
024 * <p>  
025 * The name is prefixed with <code>Zzz</code> to avoid confusion in case the
026 * original classes are also available in classpath.  
027 */
028
029
030/**
031 * <p>
032 * This class assists in validating arguments.
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * The class is based along the lines of JUnit. If an argument value is deemed
036 * invalid, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. For example:
037 * </p>
038 * 
039 * <pre>
040 * Validate.isTrue(i &gt; 0, &quot;The value must be greater than zero: &quot;, i);
041 * Validate.notNull(surname, &quot;The surname must not be null&quot;);
042 * </pre>
043 * 
044 * @author Apache Software Foundation
045 * @author <a href="mailto:ola.berg@arkitema.se">Ola Berg</a>
046 * @author Gary Gregory
047 * @author Norm Deane
048 * @since 2.0
049 * @version $Id: Validate.java 905636 2010-02-02 14:03:32Z niallp $
050 */
051public class ZzzValidate {
052    // Validate has no dependencies on other classes in Commons Lang at present
053
054    /**
055     * Constructor. This class should not normally be instantiated.
056     */
057    public ZzzValidate() {
058        super();
059    }
060
061    // notNull
062    // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
063
064    /**
065     * <p>
066     * Validate that the specified argument is not <code>null</code>; otherwise
067     * throwing an exception.
068     * 
069     * <pre>
070     * Validate.notNull(myObject);
071     * </pre>
072     * <p>
073     * The message of the exception is &quot;The validated object is null&quot;.
074     * </p>
075     * 
076     * @param object the object to check
077     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the object is <code>null</code>
078     */
079    public static void notNull(Object object) {
080        notNull(object, "The validated object is null");
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * <p>
085     * Validate that the specified argument is not <code>null</code>; otherwise
086     * throwing an exception with the specified message.
087     * 
088     * <pre>
089     * Validate.notNull(myObject, &quot;The object must not be null&quot;);
090     * </pre>
091     * 
092     * @param object the object to check
093     * @param message the exception message if invalid
094     */
095    public static void notNull(Object object, String message) {
096        if (object == null) {
097            throw new IllegalArgumentException(message);
098        }
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * <p>
103     * Validate that the argument condition is <code>true</code>; otherwise
104     * throwing an exception with the specified message. This method is useful
105     * when validating according to an arbitrary boolean expression, such as
106     * validating a primitive number or using your own custom validation
107     * expression.
108     * </p>
109     * 
110     * <pre>
111     * Validate.isTrue((i &gt; 0), &quot;The value must be greater than zero&quot;);
112     * Validate.isTrue(myObject.isOk(), &quot;The object is not OK&quot;);
113     * </pre>
114     * 
115     * @param expression the boolean expression to check
116     * @param message the exception message if invalid
117     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if expression is <code>false</code>
118     */
119    public static void isTrue(boolean expression, String message) {
120        if (expression == false) {
121            throw new IllegalArgumentException(message);
122        }
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Validates that the given collection is not empty.
127     * 
128     * @param collection
129     * @param collectionName
130     */
131    public static void isNotEmpty(Collection<?> collection,
132            String collectionName) {
133        notNull(collection, collectionName + " must not be null");
134        isTrue(!collection.isEmpty(), collectionName + " must not be empty");
135    }
136
137    //
138    // extensions of the third-party code (not part of the third-party code)
139    //
140
141    public static void isZeroOrPositiveNumber(double number, String variableName) {
142        if (number < 0) {
143            throw new IllegalArgumentException(variableName
144                    + " must be a zero or a positive number but was " + number);
145        }
146    }
147
148    public static void isGreaterThanZero(double number, String variableName) {
149        if (number <= 0) {
150            throw new IllegalArgumentException(variableName
151                    + " must be greather than zero but was " + number);
152        }
153    }
154}
